page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION.
page.content: The whole area covered by our twelve kilometre squares is a rural one.Part of Pulloxhill village with the school and the church is included as also are the outskirts of Barton,Harlington and Sharpenhoe.The majority of the area is one of very large arable fields. The two dominating crops are barley and oil-seed rape. During the last twenty years several farms have been amalgamated and the people living in the farm houses have no connection with farming. Many hedges and trees have disappeared so that fields may now be as much as 60 acres in size. Some farmers have planted small copses of trees in awkward corners of fields where the large machinery cannot reach. There are no main roads in the area at all.
